news.title: 2024 Eastern Region Soccer League Awards held in Triangle
news.content:
Story by Gay Matambo

The Eastern Region Soccer League held its 2024 annual awards ceremony this weekend, where outstanding players, coaches and referees for the just ended soccer season were awarded for their sterling performance.

The awards ceremony, which took place this Saturday at Triangle Country Club, saw players who include Ali Sadiki from Triangle United Football Club, Junior Peter Mushure from FC Wangu Mazodze and Tawanda Chatuluka from FC Hunters scooping medals for being part of the 11 best players of the past season.

“I promise our supporters that we are going to do better in the PSL. I have never led a team that got relegated, and I’m confident that TUFC will never be relegated,” said Triangle United Football Club coach, Luke Masomere.

Midfielder, Ali Sadiki said, “I want to thank God for this award and this is a motivation to the youngsters when they see someone like me winning this award and it also motivates my age mates to say that age is just a number they only have to work hard.”

ZIFA Easter Region chairperson, Mr Davison Muchena said they are targeting to promote more teams into the top tier of Zimbabwean Football as Triangle United Football Club joins Manica Diamonds, Bikita Minerals and Green Fuel, bringing the total number of teams from the Eastern Region Soccer League to four.

“Our season was successful, and today we came to Triangle to celebrate the success of the youngsters who managed to play from day 1 up to the end of the season. We also want to give under 19s a chance because we want them to grow. The year was ok, and competition was also top class in the Eastern region,” he said.

ZIFA chief executive officer, Ms Yvonne Manwa, who was one of the high profile guests at the event, cited the importance of unity in the development of football in Zimbabwe.

She said, “For football to be successful we should join hands, support and sponsor it. We all have a mandate to make football successful in our country. If we work together, you will find out that we will all be successful in promoting soccer in Zimbabwe.”

FC Hunters Football Club scooped the most improved team award while Surrey FC went home with most disciplined team award.

The Golden boot winner award went to Tadiwa Mambudzi of Mutare City after scoring 15 goals in the just ended season with Munyaradzi Bakayawo scooping the referee of the year award.

Best 11 Eastern Region Soccer League players
Ali Sadiki, Triangle United Football Club
Junior Peter Mushure, FC Wangu Mazodze
Tawanda Chatuluka, FC Hunters
David Chirandu, Destiny Stars
Bennedict Musana, Chiredzi Stars
Clive Madande, Rusitu Tigers
Leon Ngwenya, Renco Mine, Theophilous Musiye, Huku F.C
Malvin Dumbura, Tenax F.C
Aldridge Mubango, Buffaloes F.C
Eddy Kanyangu
Tadiwa Mambudzi, Mutare City

Other individual winners are:
Most improved team – FC Hunters
Most Disciplined team – Surrey F.C
Best Adminstrator – Buffaloes F.C
Chairman of the season – Tenax FC

Special Awards
Most promising player – Eddie Kanyangu (18), Manica Diamond
Golden Glove – Junior Mushure, F.C Wangu Mazodze
Golden Boot winner:  Tadiwa Mambudzi (15 goals), Mutare City
Coach of the year – Luke Masomere, Triangle United
Most Promising coach – Hebron Makukutu Manica Diamonds Juniors

news.title: ZIFA asked to take appropriate steps to bring European brigade to the Warriors
news.content:
Story by Raynald Ngwarati
The incoming Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) board has a tough assignment ahead to take Zimbabwe to the next heights in football by tapping into the country’s abundant football talent based in Europe and other continents.
From the days of Peter Ndlovu who became the first African export in the modern English Premier League era and former Liverpool goal minder Bruce Grobelaar, Zimbabwe has always produced exciting football talent.
The older generations always reminisce the ‘Dream Team’ under German coach Reinhard Fabisch which was arguably the best ever Warriors squad, however about two-decades later in the era of another German gaffer, Michael Nees the best days for Zimbabwean football seem to be knocking on the door yet again if the appropriate steps are taken.
While it has always been a dream to have a squad dominated by players playing at the highest level in Europe, Zimbabwe is now at its peak in terms of football talent with the likes of Trey Nyoni, Isaac Mabaya, Shumhaira Mheuka, Leon Chiwome and Michael Ndiweni featuring in England topflight senior teams.
Although promising to be a powerhouse if the young talent pledges allegiance to represent Zimbabwe, most of the talent has not been formally approached although others have highlighted their interest in donning the country’s colors.
Former footballer and analyst, Justice Majabvi told the ZBC News, “We used to wish this when it was happening to the West Africans and maybe North Africa as well when they had all players with vast experience and also exposure in Europe. So now it’s our turn as we have youngsters some of whom were born in Europe and some in Zimbabwe, but moved to Europe when they were young.”
Majabvi believes these youngsters can agree to play for the Warriors if approached by the football governing body in the country.

news.title: Gems finish 3rd best in Africa Netball Cup
news.content:
Story by Raynald Ngwarati

The Zimbabwe senior women’s netball team have clinched bronze at the Africa Netball Cup in Namibia after beating Malawi 48-42 in a third-place play off this Saturday.

After missing out on the final this Friday, the Gems re-grouped and found their tempo this Saturday as they outclassed Malawi to seal third spot finish at the 2024 Africa Netball Cup.

The Zimbabwean outfit were greedy to bring a medal back home, but in their way stood an equally hungry Malawian side they’ve never beaten before.

With both sides seeking for the bragging rights to clinch the single medal on offer, Zimbabwe were the first to put the foot on the pedal of aggression, showing intent from the get go.

At the halfway stage of the match, Zimbabwe were leading 25-19, holding on to a six goal cushion which gave the ladies a boost in their confidence.

news.title: ZKU Champ of Champs returns in style
news.content:
Story by Raynald Ngwarati

The Zimbabwe Karate Union Champion of Champions tournament has marked its return on the ZKU calendar this Saturday attracting the attention of more than 18 karate styles to the Glamis Arena.

After a four-year absence, the tournament made an emphatic return this Saturday drawing karetekas from different parts of the country, with nearly one hundred karatekas from across 18 different karate styles united under one roof to celebrate karate excellence and proffer a platform for talent identification.

“Our young men and young women are here to participate. Our main aim is to educate them on discipline. It’s not about fighting people but fighting their weaknesses and fighting their challenges in life,” said karateka, Shihan Rodwell Njerere.

ZKU Secretary General Precious Garikai said, “We’re trying to unite karate as a whole, we have different styles but in the differences we have to be one to be a force to reckon with.”

news.title: Simba Bhora celebrates historic PSL win
news.content:
Story by Tapiwa Machemedze

A carnival atmosphere engulfed Shamva on Friday as Premier Soccer League winners Simba Bhora football club finally took the coveted trophy to their home fans at Wadzanai Stadium.

The Premier soccer league carnival to announce the historic arrival of the PSL trophy began in Mazowe, passed through Bindura and ended in Shamva where delighted soccer fans embraced the PSL trophy won by a Mashonaland Central team for the first time.

A supporter said, “We are happy, we want to thank Simba Ndoro, the vice president, his wife, because this thing had never happened in Mashonaland Central. We are very happy because of Simba Bhora.”

“As the Brass Band, we are happy because we started in Division One. Brass band we have never missed a game. We started in Division One and now we are in the premier league,” another said.

Simba Bhora players expressed joy at being part of the history making team.

“It’s pleasing from the people of Mashonaland central, it’s what we wished for since we joined this team. I want to thank our supporters as we go to the CAF championships we need your support,” one of the players said.

Another noted, “I am very happy because we took the league, we took it on our second year. I want to thank all Mashonaland Central supporters they came in numbers. I come from this side, so I am honoured and I am happy.”

Mashonaland Central Minister of State for Provincial Affairs and Devolution, Honourable Christopher Magomo joined in the celebrations officially opening Wadzanai Stadium re-built by Simba Bhora president, Simba Ndoro and ceremonially handing over the PSL trophy to the team.
